content: When I got the truck. I had a squeak coming from the bushings in my stacks Peterbilt. if you're watching this the squeaky stacks. you're telling me y'all couldn't grease those bushings when you put them together that's ridiculous brand new truck squeaking.
author: TruckerMike

content: Overall. it seems kind of like the the fit and finish and the build quality of the truck is is kind of poor. especially see that in the electrical system as I was just talking about with the Gremlins. and stuff but uh material wise it feels like a lot of just kind of like real cheap plastic. and that could change depending on your model I'm not sure it just doesn't it doesn't feel like you're getting your money's worth as far as materials. and the fit and finish of the truck is concerned.
author: FleetManager2024

content: Mine came with a lovely oil leak, took 2 weeks to get the part.
author: nitrobass24

content: I'm so sorry to hear that whoever ordered your trucks didn't know to never spec piece of shit Paccars instead of X15s. Oh well, enjoy them for the 400,000 miles that they'll last before spinning cams and bearings.
author: Smart-Atmosphere4797

content: I see all those electronics and plastic pieces and all I could think is, 'that's job security for anyone who works on those because age will crack plastic and electrical shit will fail because it's Tuesday and the moon was looking a little funny.
author: OldSchoolTrucker

content: Good god, what a mess. Makes you appreciate the 389 and X15.
author: Bombsquad68

content: Within the 4 months, 14 out of the 22 have been sent to the shop for engine repairs. What's happening? Is it just my luck, or has peterbilt gone down hill these days?
author: FleetOwnerJohn

content: New Peterbilts are JUNK! Hey drivers, I need to vent for a second. 4-5 years ago we leased 22 day cab 579s, all 2016. The first year with them was great. No problems whatsoever, but after that first year, they all went down hill.
author: FrustratedDriver

content: Brand new truck tour 2024 peterbilt 579, already having problems!
author: OTR Trucking

content: The only other beef I have with this truck is the infotainment system. I mean did Fred Flintstone design this son bitch. like it is so out of date for a 2020 truck.
author: CashisKingTrucking

content: Just picked up my new 389 with the Cummins X15. Absolutely love this truck! The power is incredible and the ride quality is smooth as butter. Best decision I ever made.
author: HappyOwnerOp

content: Peterbilt dealer service is top notch. Had an issue with my DEF system and they had me back on the road in 4 hours. That's how you keep customers!
author: LongHaulLarry

content: 579 EPIQ package is the real deal. Getting 8.5 mpg consistently. Fuel savings alone are paying for the truck.
author: FuelEfficientFleet

content: Third Peterbilt in my fleet and never had major issues. Maintenance is key people. Take care of your truck and it takes care of you.
author: VeteranTrucker

content: The 389 is still the king of the road. Nothing beats that classic look with modern reliability. Turning heads everywhere I go.
author: ClassicTruckFan

content: Peterbilt parts prices are absolutely insane. $800 for a mirror assembly? Come on now. This is why owner operators are struggling.
author: BudgetTrucker

content: Waiting 3 weeks for a turbo for my 579. Dealer says supply chain issues. Meanwhile I'm losing $1500 a day sitting here.
author: DowntimeDisaster

content: Model 567 is the perfect vocational truck. Running it in construction and it handles everything we throw at it. Built like a tank.
author: ConstructionKing

content: Aftertreatment system on my 2021 579 has been nothing but problems. DPF regeneration issues constantly. Shop can't figure it out.
author: EmissionsNightmare

content: Just hit 1 million miles on my 2018 389. Original engine, original transmission. Peterbilt quality is real when you maintain it right.
author: MillionMiler

content: The new 579EV electric truck is impressive but the range just isn't there yet for long haul. Maybe in 5 years.
author: EVSkeptic

content: Peterbilt's driver training program is excellent. They really invest in making sure you know your truck inside and out.
author: NewDriverDan

content: HVAC system in my 579 sleeper is garbage. Can't keep it cool in summer or warm in winter. Dealer says it's normal. BS!
author: SleeplessDriver

content: Resale value on Peterbilts is unmatched. Sold my 5 year old 389 for only 30% less than I paid. Try that with any other brand.
author: SmartInvestor

content: Steering issues on my new 579. Dealer says alignment is fine but it pulls to the right constantly. Very frustrating.
author: SteeringProblems

content: The 389 Pride and Class edition is absolutely stunning. Worth every penny for that interior package.
author: LuxuryTrucker

content: Transmission issues at 150k miles. Eaton says it's a known problem but Peterbilt won't cover it. Out of warranty by 2 months.
author: WarrantyWoes

content: SmartNav system finally got a decent update. About time they modernized the interface. Still not as good as aftermarket options though.
author: TechTrucker

content: Peterbilt customer service is a joke. Been on hold for 2 hours trying to get warranty info. This is unacceptable.
author: CustomerServiceFail

content: Running my 579 in Canada through -40 winters. This truck starts every time. Peterbilt knows how to build for cold weather.
author: CanadianTrucker
